entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 2:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Through Tuesday... Water levels on rivers and streams have risen sharply on the Seward Peninsula and in the western Brooks Range, as the remnants of typhoon Merbok tracked northeastward through the Bering Strait and Chukchi Sea. Between 1 to 3 inches of rain have fallen so far with an additional 1 to 2 inches possible through Monday night in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 3:08AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Young children and pets should never be left
